page.title: 06BOATING ON THE LERRYN RIVER
page.content: Nowadays, almost all boating is for pleasure, and on a busy summer weekend you can see all kinds of craft coming upstream to{Lerryn}on the tide, or stopping to picnic on one of the grassy banks. Launches from{Fowey}also bring passengers to Lerryn for either tea at the W.I. hall or a meal at "The Ship Inn". Small hire motor boats, rowing boats, sailing dinghies, canoes and now even windsurfers, enliven the scene with their brightly coloured sails. Many{residents}in Lerryn own their own boats which they use for fishing trips down the river and out on the open sea. Shopping in Fowey can also be done this way, if the tide is right. The{deep water channel}that boats can safely use, is winding and narrow, and care has to be taken.
